column4: still hanging around looking for an answer to the following:  is it at all possible for ubuntu to have caused the following error in a drive utility "Uncorrectable data error or media is write protected" ?
is it a NTFS drive?
it's a drive with an ntfs partition, a small fat partition, and unpartitioned space (deleted ubuntu partition)
and none of the partitions appear?
well, since i deleted the ubuntu partition (don't ask...) it's not bootable.  but the drive won't mount in a live cd, and the installer seems to go into some infinite loop at loading the partitioner
it's a good live cd...this happens with both 8.04 and 8.10 daily image
tried booting in windows (if you can) and then shutting restarting your comp?
there's an issue with NTFS drives when they weren't properly shut down afaik
forgive me if this is a dumb question, but how would i go about booting into windows?  grub took over as the bootloader, and the linux partition was deleted
do you have access to a CD burner? if yes, create a supergrub CD
i do.  i've never heard of that.  any more info, or should i google it and learn on my own?
one sec..  looking for the url
thanks.  i can dig it up if needed.
http://www.supergrubdisk.org/
you shouldbe able to reboot windows using that
if you have it on one of your drive

i'll look into it.  windows still exists, i could see it using the recovery console on a windows disk.  i was just concerned about running fixmbr if there was a mechanical problem with the disk causing these errors.
yep. I understand that. Thus supergrub. it doesn't install anything. It just bypasses your disks bootloaders and so on
one of the must-have boot cds ;)
thanks for the help, it's very much appreciated.  i'll probably try to find you again if i run into questions (if that's all right).
well . I'm not a regular here ;) I only come whenever I have a uestion/problem .. and then I usually end up helping where I can
but you're welcome :)
ah, i see.  i do the same thing.
yep. astounding, but the system seems to work. So far I've always received quite usefull help, and I hopefully gave some
